messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: LINDA STERNHILL DAVIS!!!!
messages.msgSnippet: Or you can set it up so it doesn t download at all from the isp! Vaughnde Lee Missoula, Montana http://www.stampinbookworm.eboard.com ... From: Johanna
messages.messageBody:
Or you can set it up so it doesn't download at all from the isp!
 
Vaughnde Lee
Missoula, Montana
http://www.stampinbookworm.eboard.com
-----Original Message-----
From: Johanna <saninocencio1@...>
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Date: Monday, April 23, 2001 11:37 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: LINDA STERNHILL DAVIS!!!!

the problem is the virus send the mail out like it is a personal message, not through the user group. If you are using outlook express, you can set up a filter to automatilcally remove the infected e-mail.
Click on tools and select message rules mail.
select new mail rue
select where the message body contains specific word
Select delete it for the action
in the rule description box, click on contains specific words and edit it to say "look to the attachment".
edit rule name 
click ok
 
after you do this, everything with the virus will automatically go straight to the deleted items folder
 
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: Sharon Corage
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com ; rul@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, April 23, 2001 10:36 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: LINDA STERNHILL DAVIS!!!!

Couldn't the moderator set this list not to accept attachments at least
temporarily till Linda's computer chills out on the mass mailings?
Wouldn't that bounce all the mail right out of here?

Sharon

the problem is the virus send the mail out like it is a personal message, not through the user group. If you are using outlook express, you can set up a filter to automatilcally remove the infected e-mail.
Click on tools and select message rules mail.
select new mail rue
select where the message body contains specific word
Select delete it for the action
in the rule description box, click on contains specific words and edit it to say "look to the attachment".
edit rule name

after you do this, everything with the virus will automatically go straight to the deleted items folder
 
Johanna

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] LINDA STERNHILL DAVIS!!!!
messages.msgSnippet: She can t help it....a virus is sending out emails to anyone (anything, like a list) that was unread mail the last time she shut down her computer. Just don t
messages.messageBody:
She can't help it....a virus is sending out emails to anyone (anything, like
a list) that was unread mail the last time she shut down her computer. Just
don't open those attachments!

Valerie in Tacoma, virus-free
